frameDefinitions: A System is perceived as complex depending on the intricacy of the interconnectivty of its parts or components.
A Figure is located relative to a Ground location.
An Agent manipulates a Fastener to open or close a Containing_object (e.g. coat, jar).
An Entity began its existence in the context of a Origin, which can be a place,  culture, time period, text, etc.
A member or members of a Class have just been  mentioned or are present in the discourse setting and now a different instance  (or group of instances) of the same class is referred to.
An Agent matches location with an Entity in order to fulfill some  Purpose.
frameExamples: San Diego freeways are a <t>complex</t> array of poorly maintained roads.
Mary <t>closed</t> her coat with a belt.
The Christian <t>origin</t> of this quote is from Isaiah 22.
My husband left me for <t>another</t> woman -- and now wants to get back together again!
I ca n't remember how many times he <t>visited</t> ! DNI
listRoleDefinitions: The complete entity or system whose complexity is under consideration.
The <fen>Ground</fen> serves as a basis for describing the location of the <fen>Figure</fen>.
The <fen>Figure</fen> is perceived as located relative to a certain <fen>Ground</fen> location. The figure can be an entity or an event.
The <fen>Figures</fen> are items which mutually serve to identify the location of the other items.
The region within which a <fen>Figure</fen> might be found.  This role is exclusive of <fen>Figure</fen>, and is a reconstrual that is not possible with verb lexical units.
The period of time during which the locative relation between <fen>Figure</fen> and <fen>Ground</fen> obtains.

This role identifies the item that is closed by the agent with the fastener.
<fex name='Agent'>Lee</fex> <t>buttoned</t> <fex name='Containing_object'>his coat</fex>.
The Agent opens/closes the Containing-object.
This role identifies the fastener that the agent manipulates.
This role identifies the active zone of the container that may be expressed as the direct object of the target verb.
The time at which the <fen>Agent</fen> closes the <fen>Container_portal</fen> or the <fen>Containing_object</fen>.
The location where the closing event takes place.
The item whose <fen>Origin</fen> is under discussion.
The place or culture where the <fen>Entity</fen> was produced.
The general category of entity which has been referred to.
The instance of the <fen>Class</fen> that is added to the <fen>Initial_set</fen> of entities in the <fen>Class</fen>.
The previously mentioned group of entities of the <fen>Class</fen>.
The sentient entity that is temporarily with the <fen>Entity</fen> in order to fulfil some <fen>Purpose</fen>.

The physical entity that is permanently associated with entities or characteristics that the <fen>Agent</fen> wishes to use for some <fen>Purpose</fen>.  During the visit, the <fen>Agent</fen> matches location with the <fen>Entity</fen>.
The time at which a visit is made.
A description of the position of the <fen>Agent</fen> during the visit.
listRoleExamples: <fex><t>Next to</t> the kitchen</fex> is the best place to locate your garage .
Marcus tied his shoe <fex>with the neon-green shoelaces</fex>.
They close the bank vault <fex>at precisely 5:35PM</fex>.
Shouldn't you have buttoned that <fex>in the bathroom</fex>?
My Husband left me for another <fex>man</fex>!
A further five incursions <fex>over and above those noted for 1995</fex> took place in the first three months of 1996.

sourceCandidateSpans.text: Nocturne or the Digital Devil Saga
